intro: Oryzopsis kopetdaghensis, commonly known as the Kopetdagh grass, is a species of grass native to Central Asia, particularly found in the Kopetdagh region of Turkmenistan and Iran. It is a perennial plant that thrives in arid and semi-arid environments, often growing in rocky or sandy soils. The plant has narrow, grass-like leaves and produces small, spikelet-based flowers typical of the Poaceae family. It plays a role in stabilizing soil in its native habitat and is adapted to withstand drought conditions. Oryzopsis kopetdaghensis is of interest to botanists due to its unique ecological adaptations and potential for study in xerophytic plant research.
